headline: Intel's AI client, bitcoin hits June low, Micron's China business
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma tracks Friday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Micron (MU) stock is falling after Reuters reported that the chipmaker plans to exit China's server business. Intel (INTC) stock is climbing on reports that the company's foundry secured a big artificial intelligence (AI) client. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) fell to its lowest level since June. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Intel's AI client, bitcoin hits June low, Micron's China business

Micron (MU) stock is falling after Reuters reported that the chipmaker plans to exit China's server business.

Intel (INTC) stock is climbing on reports that the company's foundry secured a big artificial intelligence (AI) client.

Bitcoin (BTC-USD) fell to its lowest level since June.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Micron Stock Drops. It’s Waving Goodbye to Some China Business, Says Report.
summary: Micron Technology  stock dropped Friday.  The memory chip company looks to be resigning itself to losing business in China.  Micron is set to stop supplying server chips to Chinese data centers after being targeted by a ban from Beijing on the use of its products in critical infrastructure, although it will continue to sell chips to automotive and smartphone customers in the country, Reuters reported Friday, citing people briefed on the decision.

content.title: Micron Stock Drops. It’s Waving Goodbye to Some China Business, Says Report.
content.summary: Micron Technology  stock dropped Friday.  The memory chip company looks to be resigning itself to losing business in China.  Micron is set to stop supplying server chips to Chinese data centers after being targeted by a ban from Beijing on the use of its products in critical infrastructure, although it will continue to sell chips to automotive and smartphone customers in the country, Reuters reported Friday, citing people briefed on the decision.

headline: Tesla, Nvidia, Rigetti, Praxis: Trending Stocks
summary: Tesla (TSLA) continued its slide in the pre-market on another bearish analyst report, and mounting questions around Elon Musk company's ability to deliver on robotics and AI promises. Nvidia (NVDA) shares swing down then recover some ground ahead of the open. Meta (META) is close to a $30 billion financing deal for a data center in Louisiana, and shares of its AI glasses partner EssilorLuxottica (EL.PA) hit a new record. Micron (MU) abandons some of its chip supplying activities in China. Other top gainers and losers include Praxis (PRAX) and Rigetti (RGTI). For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Exclusive-Micron to exit server chips business in China after ban, sources say
summary: SEOUL/SHANGHAI (Reuters) -Micron plans to stop supplying server chips to data centres in China after the business failed to recover from a 2023 government ban on its products in critical Chinese infrastructure, two people briefed on the decision said.  Micron was the first U.S. chipmaker to be targeted by Beijing - a move that was seen as retaliatory for a series of curbs by Washington aimed at impeding tech progress by China's semiconductor industry.  Micron will continue to sell to two Chinese customers that have significant data centre operations outside China, one of which is laptop maker Lenovo, the people said.

content.title: Exclusive-Micron to exit server chips business in China after ban, sources say
content.summary: SEOUL/SHANGHAI (Reuters) -Micron plans to stop supplying server chips to data centres in China after the business failed to recover from a 2023 government ban on its products in critical Chinese infrastructure, two people briefed on the decision said.  Micron was the first U.S. chipmaker to be targeted by Beijing - a move that was seen as retaliatory for a series of curbs by Washington aimed at impeding tech progress by China's semiconductor industry.  Micron will continue to sell to two Chinese customers that have significant data centre operations outside China, one of which is laptop maker Lenovo, the people said.

headline: Micron Technology (MU): Assessing Valuation Following Analyst Upgrades on AI and DRAM Growth Prospects
summary: Several major analysts just upgraded Micron Technology (MU), citing tightening DRAM supply and a clear upswing in high-bandwidth memory demand. Their optimism comes as AI and data center trends continue to bolster the company’s outlook. See our latest analysis for Micron Technology.
